snippet: Members of the players union began voting on whether to give the executive board the authority to file a disclaimer of interest, a move that would allow individual players to file antitrust suits against the league.
abstract: Members of the NHL players union begin voting on whether to give the executive board the authority to file a disclaimer of interest, move that would allow individual players to file antitrust suits against the league; NHL responds by filing suit in federal court in New York to confirm the lockout's legality.
lead_paragraph: Members of the players union began voting on whether to give the executive board the authority to file a disclaimer of interest, a move that would allow individual players to file antitrust suits against the league.

headline.seo: N.H.L. Players Voting on Whether to Give Authority to Dissolve Union
headline.main: Voting Begins to Give Board Authority to Dissolve N.H.L. Players Union
headline.print_headline: Voting Begins on Whether To Dissolve Players Union
